Act of Aggression.name: Act of Aggression
Act of Aggression.text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

Alloy Myr.name: Alloy Myr
Alloy Myr.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

printings.flavor: With or without witnesses, the suns continued their prismatic dance.

Apostle's Blessing.name: Apostle's Blessing
Apostle's Blessing.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Target artifact or creature you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.

Argent Mutation.name: Argent Mutation
Argent Mutation.text:
Target permanent becomes an artifact in addition to its other types until end of turn.
Draw a card.

printings.flavor:
"My world is corrupted beyond cleansing. I must prevent this from happening to other worlds."
—Karn

Arm with Æther.name: Arm with Æther
Arm with Æther.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, you may return target creature that player controls to its owner's hand."

printings.flavor: "Anything we can do to hurt the Phyrexian invaders is worth dying for."

Artillerize.name: Artillerize
Artillerize.text:
As an additional cost to cast Artillerize, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Artillerize deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

printings.flavor: Phyrexian or Mirran, most goblins stick to the job they know best.

Auriok Survivors.name: Auriok Survivors
Auriok Survivors.text: When Auriok Survivors enters the battlefield, you may return target Equipment card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If you do, you may attach it to Auriok Survivors.

printings.flavor: "We are Mirrodin's children. We will reclaim her—one scrap at a time, if we have to."

Batterskull.name: Batterskull
Batterskull.text:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +4/+4 and has vigilance and lifelink.
{3}: Return Batterskull to its owner's hand.
Equip {5}

Beast Within.name: Beast Within
Beast Within.text: Destroy target permanent. Its controller puts a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

printings.flavor:
"Kill the weak so they can't drag the strong down to their level. This is true compassion."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

Birthing Pod.name: Birthing Pod
Birthing Pod.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
{1}{G/P}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost equal to 1 plus the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

Blade Splicer.name: Blade Splicer
Blade Splicer.text:
When Blade Splicer enters the battlefield, put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
Golem creatures you control have first strike.

Blighted Agent.name: Blighted Agent
Blighted Agent.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Blighted Agent can't be blocked.

printings.flavor:
"Urabrask may suspect our surveillance, but he cannot stop it."
—Avaricta, Gitaxian sective

Blind Zealot.name: Blind Zealot
Blind Zealot.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever Blind Zealot deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature that player controls.

Blinding Souleater.name: Blinding Souleater
Blinding Souleater.text: {W/P}, {T}: Tap target creature. ({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)

printings.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for inscribing our souls with subservience, to reinforce the sacred order."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

Bludgeon Brawl.name: Bludgeon Brawl
Bludgeon Brawl.text: Each noncreature, non-Equipment artifact is an Equipment with equip {X} and "Equipped creature gets +X/+0," where X is that artifact's converted mana cost.

Brutalizer Exarch.name: Brutalizer Exarch
Brutalizer Exarch.text:
When Brutalizer Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
• Put target noncreature permanent on the bottom of its owner's library.

Caged Sun.name: Caged Sun
Caged Sun.text:
As Caged Sun enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Creatures you control of the chosen color get +1/+1.
Whenever a land's ability adds one or more mana of the chosen color to your mana pool, add one additional mana of that color to your mana pool.

Caress of Phyrexia.name: Caress of Phyrexia
Caress of Phyrexia.text: Target player draws three cards, loses 3 life, and gets three poison counters.

printings.flavor: "I am weak. Make . . . me . . . ideal."

Cathedral Membrane.name: Cathedral Membrane
Cathedral Membrane.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Defender
When Cathedral Membrane dies during combat, it deals 6 damage to each creature it blocked this combat.

Chained Throatseeker.name: Chained Throatseeker
Chained Throatseeker.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Chained Throatseeker can't attack unless defending player is poisoned.

Chancellor of the Annex.name: Chancellor of the Annex
Chancellor of the Annex.text:
You may reveal this card from your opening hand. If you do, when each opponent casts his or her first spell of the game, counter that spell unless that player pays {1}.
Flying
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, counter it unless that player pays {1}.

Chancellor of the Dross.name: Chancellor of the Dross
Chancellor of the Dross.text:
You may reveal this card from your opening hand. If you do, at the beginning of the first upkeep, each opponent loses 3 life, then you gain life equal to the life lost this way.
Flying, lifelink

Chancellor of the Forge.name: Chancellor of the Forge
Chancellor of the Forge.text:
You may reveal this card from your opening hand. If you do, at the beginning of the first upkeep, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token with haste onto the battlefield.
When Chancellor of the Forge enters the battlefield, put X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield, where X is the number of creatures you control.

Chancellor of the Spires.name: Chancellor of the Spires
Chancellor of the Spires.text:
You may reveal this card from your opening hand. If you do, at the beginning of the first upkeep, each opponent puts the top seven cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Flying
When Chancellor of the Spires enters the battlefield, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from an opponent's graveyard without paying its mana cost.

Chancellor of the Tangle.name: Chancellor of the Tangle
Chancellor of the Tangle.text:
You may reveal this card from your opening hand. If you do, at the beginning of your first main phase, add {G} to your mana pool.
Vigilance, reach

Conversion Chamber.name: Conversion Chamber
Conversion Chamber.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard. Put a charge counter on Conversion Chamber.
{2}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Conversion Chamber: Put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

Corrosive Gale.name: Corrosive Gale
Corrosive Gale.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Corrosive Gale deals X damage to each creature with flying.

printings.flavor:
"Wipe Sheoldred's spies from the sky. She'll see the result of our vision soon enough."
—Glissa

Corrupted Resolve.name: Corrupted Resolve
Corrupted Resolve.text: Counter target spell if its controller is poisoned.

printings.flavor:
"Flesh is a sickness that infects Phyrexia."
—Avaricta, Gitaxian sective

Darksteel Relic.name: Darksteel Relic
Darksteel Relic.text: Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this artifact.)

printings.flavor:
"It's the last thing we can call our own."
—Minhu, Mirran resistance

Death-Hood Cobra.name: Death-Hood Cobra
Death-Hood Cobra.text:
{1}{G}: Death-Hood Cobra gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
{1}{G}: Death-Hood Cobra gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

Deceiver Exarch.name: Deceiver Exarch
Deceiver Exarch.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Deceiver Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Untap target permanent you control.
• Tap target permanent an opponent controls.

printings.flavor:
"It isn't for fighting. It's for when the fighting's gone bad."
—Kara Vrist, Mirran resistance

Dementia Bat.name: Dementia Bat
Dementia Bat.text:
Flying
{4}{B}, Sacrifice Dementia Bat: Target player discards two cards.

printings.flavor:
"When terror outweighs all other thoughts, they will understand that I am the true Father of Machines."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

Despise.name: Despise
Despise.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature or planeswalker card from it. That player discards that card.

printings.flavor:
"Truth is always a weapon in your enemies' hands."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

Dismember.name: Dismember
Dismember.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

Dispatch.name: Dispatch
Dispatch.text:
Tap target creature.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, exile that creature.

printings.flavor: Venser wondered if it could still be called a teleportation spell if the destination is oblivion.

Due Respect.name: Due Respect
Due Respect.text:
Permanents enter the battlefield tapped this turn.
Draw a card.

printings.flavor:
"A display of humility is required of those who still possess such frailties."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite.name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite.text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.

printings.flavor: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."

Enslave.name: Enslave
Enslave.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.

printings.flavor: Phyrexia extended its command until there was nothing left to take.

Entomber Exarch.name: Entomber Exarch
Entomber Exarch.text:
When Entomber Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target opponent reveals his or her hand, you choose a noncreature card from it, then that player discards that card.

Etched Monstrosity.name: Etched Monstrosity
Etched Monstrosity.text:
Etched Monstrosity enters the battlefield with five -1/-1 counters on it.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}, Remove five -1/-1 counters from Etched Monstrosity: Target player draws three cards.

printings.flavor: Now etched only with the scars of phyresis.

Evil Presence.name: Evil Presence
Evil Presence.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

printings.flavor:
"The Accorders would lament the transformation of their cherished lands, had they lived to see it."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

Exclusion Ritual.name: Exclusion Ritual
Exclusion Ritual.text:
Imprint — When Exclusion Ritual enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent.
Players can't cast spells with the same name as the exiled card.

printings.flavor:
"Your desires have become our discretion."
—Izathel, priest of the Annex

Fallen Ferromancer.name: Fallen Ferromancer
Fallen Ferromancer.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{1}{R}, {T}: Fallen Ferromancer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

printings.flavor:
"Large or small, all will toil for the Great Work."
—Decree of Urabrask

Forced Worship.name: Forced Worship
Forced Worship.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
{2}{W}: Return Forced Worship to its owner's hand.

printings.flavor: Imprisonment teaches revenge. Hobbling teaches resignation.

Fresh Meat.name: Fresh Meat
Fresh Meat.text: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.

printings.flavor: A scavenger's favorite appetizer is death.

Furnace Scamp.name: Furnace Scamp
Furnace Scamp.text: Whenever Furnace Scamp deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, Furnace Scamp deals 3 damage to that player.

printings.flavor: Born of the core, and dying to stoke it.

Geosurge.name: Geosurge
Geosurge.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact or creature spells.

printings.flavor:
"The mountains have been corrupted. Otherwise, they would not lend me their fire so easily."
—Koth of the Hammer

Geth's Verdict.name: Geth's Verdict
Geth's Verdict.text: Target player sacrifices a creature and loses 1 life.

printings.flavor:
"Everyone should owe you something."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

Gitaxian Probe.name: Gitaxian Probe
Gitaxian Probe.text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.

printings.flavor:
"My flesh holds no secrets, monster. The spirit of Mirrodin will fight on."
—Vy Covalt, Mirran resistance

Glissa's Scorn.name: Glissa's Scorn
Glissa's Scorn.text: Destroy target artifact. Its controller loses 1 life.

printings.flavor:
"If it were fit to survive, it wouldn't have been so easily put down."
—Glissa

Glistener Elf.name: Glistener Elf
Glistener Elf.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

printings.flavor: "Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection."

Glistening Oil.name: Glistening Oil
Glistening Oil.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
When Glistening Oil is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Glistening Oil to its owner's hand.

Greenhilt Trainee.name: Greenhilt Trainee
Greenhilt Trainee.text: {T}: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Greenhilt Trainee's power is 4 or greater.

printings.flavor: "Our ancestors adapted to this world of metal. Just as they did, we will adapt to this world of evil."

Gremlin Mine.name: Gremlin Mine
Gremlin Mine.text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Gremlin Mine: Gremlin Mine deals 4 damage to target artifact creature.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Gremlin Mine: Remove up to four charge counters from target noncreature artifact.

Grim Affliction.name: Grim Affliction
Grim Affliction.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

printings.flavor: Even the small wounds let hope bleed out.

Gut Shot.name: Gut Shot
Gut Shot.text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Gut Shot deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

printings.flavor:
"Down here, we have a more pointed version of the scriptures."
—Urabrask's enforcer

Hex Parasite.name: Hex Parasite
Hex Parasite.text: {X}{B/P}: Remove up to X counters from target permanent. For each counter removed this way, Hex Parasite gets +1/+0 until end of turn. ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)

printings.flavor: Drawn by power, fueled by conquest.
Originally created to harvest blinkmoths, the hovermyr are now the silent observers of a dying world.

Ichor Explosion.name: Ichor Explosion
Ichor Explosion.text:
As an additional cost to cast Ichor Explosion, sacrifice a creature.
All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.

printings.flavor: The first explosion that didn't excite goblins.

Immolating Souleater.name: Immolating Souleater
Immolating Souleater.text: {R/P}: Immolating Souleater gets +1/+0 until end of turn. ({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)

printings.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for melting the sinful that we may be reminded of our own insignificance."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

Impaler Shrike.name: Impaler Shrike
Impaler Shrike.text:
Flying
Whenever Impaler Shrike deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, draw three cards.

printings.flavor:
"Interrogation is an unnecessary step for acquiring information."
—Politus, Gitaxian morphologist

Inquisitor Exarch.name: Inquisitor Exarch
Inquisitor Exarch.text:
When Inquisitor Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• You gain 2 life.
• Target opponent loses 2 life.

printings.flavor:
"Skin is the prison of the blessed and the stronghold of the heretic."
—Argent Etchings, plate 64, passage 17

Insatiable Souleater.name: Insatiable Souleater
Insatiable Souleater.text: {G/P}: Insatiable Souleater gains trample until end of turn. ({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)

printings.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for culling our sick so that the strong may earn their triumphs."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

Invader Parasite.name: Invader Parasite
Invader Parasite.text:
Imprint — When Invader Parasite enters the battlefield, exile target land.
Whenever a land with the same name as the exiled card enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, Invader Parasite deals 2 damage to that player.

Isolation Cell.name: Isolation Cell
Isolation Cell.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, that player loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}.

printings.flavor:
"Attrition is the answer. Starve them, and let their despair be their undoing."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur.name: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur.text:
Flash
At the beginning of your end step, draw seven cards.
Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by seven.

printings.flavor: "It is not a goal, but a process—the process of creating the perfect Phyrexia."

Jor Kadeen, the Prevailer.name: Jor Kadeen, the Prevailer
Jor Kadeen, the Prevailer.text:
First strike
Metalcraft — Creatures you control get +3/+0 as long as you control three or more artifacts.

printings.flavor: "As long as my hand holds a blade, there's hope for a pure Mirrodin once again."

Karn Liberated.name: Karn Liberated
Karn Liberated.text:
+4: Target player exiles a card from his or her hand.
−3: Exile target permanent.
−14: Restart the game, leaving in exile all non-Aura permanent cards exiled with Karn Liberated. Then put those cards onto the battlefield under your control.

Kiln Walker.name: Kiln Walker
Kiln Walker.text: Whenever Kiln Walker attacks, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: If it possesses an ability to understand and appreciate life, it has never shown it.

Lashwrithe.name: Lashwrithe
Lashwrithe.text:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each Swamp you control.
Equip {B/P}{B/P} ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)

Leeching Bite.name: Leeching Bite
Leeching Bite.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: A substantial portion of Vorinclex's forces became fuel for the rest.

Life's Finale.name: Life's Finale
Life's Finale.text: Destroy all creatures, then search target opponent's library for up to three creature cards and put them into his or her graveyard. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

printings.flavor: The feeble resistance of the flesh is over. Phyrexia spreads its shadow over all.

Lost Leonin.name: Lost Leonin
Lost Leonin.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

printings.flavor: Mirrans were broken down and rebuilt, made to be loyal servants of the force they had fought.
Just one drop of the glistening oil can eventually stain even a soul as stalwart as a loxodon's beyond redemption.

Marrow Shards.name: Marrow Shards
Marrow Shards.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Marrow Shards deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

printings.flavor:
"We are a single entity. Dissenters must be sutured into the Orthodoxy."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

Master Splicer.name: Master Splicer
Master Splicer.text:
When Master Splicer enters the battlefield, put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
Golem creatures you control get +1/+1.

printings.flavor: With Phyrexia's victory at hand, each sect began perfecting its vision.

Maul Splicer.name: Maul Splicer
Maul Splicer.text:
When Maul Splicer enters the battlefield, put two 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Golem creatures you control have trample.

Melira, Sylvok Outcast.name: Melira, Sylvok Outcast
Melira, Sylvok Outcast.text:
You can't get poison counters.
Creatures you control can't have -1/-1 counters placed on them.
Creatures your opponents control lose infect.

printings.flavor: Once a pariah, now Mirrodin's greatest hope.

Mental Misstep.name: Mental Misstep
Mental Misstep.text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Counter target spell with converted mana cost 1.

printings.flavor:
"Your first mistake was thinking I would let you live long enough to make a second."
—Sarnvax, Gitaxian sective

Mindcrank.name: Mindcrank
Mindcrank.text: Whenever an opponent loses life, that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard. (Damage dealt by sources without infect causes loss of life.)

printings.flavor:
"Let go of your memories and be reborn."
—Argent Etchings, plate 106, passage 27

Mindculling.name: Mindculling
Mindculling.text: You draw two cards and target opponent discards two cards.

printings.flavor:
"Why infiltrate their strongholds when what we seek resides in such a poorly guarded safe?"
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

Moltensteel Dragon.name: Moltensteel Dragon
Moltensteel Dragon.text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Flying
{R/P}: Moltensteel Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: An apocalypse in dragon form.

Mortis Dogs.name: Mortis Dogs
Mortis Dogs.text:
Whenever Mortis Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
When Mortis Dogs dies, target player loses life equal to its power.

Mutagenic Growth.name: Mutagenic Growth
Mutagenic Growth.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

Mycosynth Fiend.name: Mycosynth Fiend
Mycosynth Fiend.text: Mycosynth Fiend gets +1/+1 for each poison counter your opponents have.

printings.flavor:
"I wish I could take credit for it, but nature progresses on its own, just the way it should."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

Mycosynth Wellspring.name: Mycosynth Wellspring
Mycosynth Wellspring.text: When Mycosynth Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

printings.flavor: The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.

Myr Superion.name: Myr Superion
Myr Superion.text: Spend only mana produced by creatures to cast Myr Superion.

printings.flavor: Two kinds of myr survive: the powerful and those that stay close by them.

Necropouncer.name: Necropouncer

Norn's Annex.name: Norn's Annex
Norn's Annex.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {W/P} for each of those creatures.

Noxious Revival.name: Noxious Revival
Noxious Revival.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Put target card from a graveyard on top of its owner's library.

printings.flavor:
"Dead or alive, my creations are stronger than Jin-Gitaxias's septic minions."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

Numbing Dose.name: Numbing Dose
Numbing Dose.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted permanent's controller, that player loses 1 life.

Ogre Menial.name: Ogre Menial
Ogre Menial.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{R}: Ogre Menial gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

Omen Machine.name: Omen Machine
Omen Machine.text:
Players can't draw cards.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player exiles the top card of his or her library. If it's a land card, the player puts it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, the player casts it without paying its mana cost if able.

Parasitic Implant.name: Parasitic Implant
Parasitic Implant.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature's controller sacrifices it and you put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

Pestilent Souleater.name: Pestilent Souleater
Pestilent Souleater.text: {B/P}: Pestilent Souleater gains infect until end of turn. ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life. A creature with infect deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

Phyrexia's Core.name: Phyrexia's Core
Phyrexia's Core.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: You gain 1 life.

printings.flavor:
"So even the heart of our world has succumbed."
—Koth of the Hammer
An invasion weapon of ages past, the glistening oil contained the blueprints of countless atrocities.

Phyrexian Ingester.name: Phyrexian Ingester
Phyrexian Ingester.text:
Imprint — When Phyrexian Ingester enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.
Phyrexian Ingester gets +X/+Y, where X is the exiled creature card's power and Y is its toughness.

Phyrexian Metamorph.name: Phyrexian Metamorph
Phyrexian Metamorph.text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
You may have Phyrexian Metamorph enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact or creature on the battlefield, except it's an artifact in addition to its other types.

Phyrexian Obliterator.name: Phyrexian Obliterator
Phyrexian Obliterator.text:
Trample
Whenever a source deals damage to Phyrexian Obliterator, that source's controller sacrifices that many permanents.

printings.flavor:
"Behold blessed perfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

Phyrexian Swarmlord.name: Phyrexian Swarmlord
Phyrexian Swarmlord.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 green Insect creature token with infect onto the battlefield for each poison counter your opponents have.

Phyrexian Unlife.name: Phyrexian Unlife
Phyrexian Unlife.text:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
As long as you have 0 or less life, all damage is dealt to you as though its source had infect. (Damage is dealt to you in the form of poison counters.)

Pith Driller.name: Pith Driller
Pith Driller.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
When Pith Driller enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

printings.flavor: After boring up through the crust of Mirrodin, it turned its expertise upon the surface dwellers.

Porcelain Legionnaire.name: Porcelain Legionnaire
Porcelain Legionnaire.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
First strike

printings.flavor:
"My new design has lightweight plating specially cultivated from heretics' spare tissues."
—Izathel, priest of the Annex

Postmortem Lunge.name: Postmortem Lunge
Postmortem Lunge.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Return target creature card with converted mana cost X from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

Praetor's Grasp.name: Praetor's Grasp
Praetor's Grasp.text: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it face down. Then that player shuffles his or her library. You may look at and play that card for as long as it remains exiled.

printings.flavor: Sheoldred weaves every thread of information into a noose to hang her enemies.

Priest of Urabrask.name: Priest of Urabrask
Priest of Urabrask.text: When Priest of Urabrask enters the battlefield, add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

printings.flavor: Even in New Phyrexia, red mana sparks glimmers of individualism, passion, and freedom.

Pristine Talisman.name: Pristine Talisman
Pristine Talisman.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. You gain 1 life.

printings.flavor:
"Tools and artisans can be destroyed, but the act of creation is inviolate."
—Elspeth Tirel

Psychic Barrier.name: Psychic Barrier
Psychic Barrier.text: Counter target creature spell. Its controller loses 1 life.

printings.flavor:
"I tolerate Phyrexians because the dragon requires it. But I have no patience for uninvited guests."
—Tezzeret

Psychic Surgery.name: Psychic Surgery
Psychic Surgery.text: Whenever an opponent shuffles his or her library, you may look at the top two cards of that library. You may exile one of those cards. Then put the rest on top of that library in any order.

Puresteel Paladin.name: Puresteel Paladin
Puresteel Paladin.text:
Whenever an Equipment enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
Metalcraft — Equipment you control have equip {0} as long as you control three or more artifacts.

Rage Extractor.name: Rage Extractor
Rage Extractor.text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Whenever you cast a spell with {P} in its mana cost, Rage Extractor deals damage equal to that spell's converted mana cost to target creature or player.

printings.flavor: New Phyrexia is an engine that both consumes and creates malice.

Razor Swine.name: Razor Swine
Razor Swine.text:
First strike
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

printings.flavor:
"They aren't helping the forges. Send them to the surface."
—Furnace boss, sector 12

Reaper of Sheoldred.name: Reaper of Sheoldred
Reaper of Sheoldred.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever a source deals damage to Reaper of Sheoldred, that source's controller gets a poison counter.

Remember the Fallen.name: Remember the Fallen
Remember the Fallen.text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

printings.flavor: When the Mirrans had fallen, Planeswalkers carried the burden of remembrance.
Vorinclex had no grand plan. The oil did its own work, evolving creatures into worthy predators.

Ruthless Invasion.name: Ruthless Invasion
Ruthless Invasion.text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Nonartifact creatures can't block this turn.

printings.flavor:
"For the survival of our people, every conflict must now end in retreat."
—Pythor, Mirran resistance

Scrapyard Salvo.name: Scrapyard Salvo
Scrapyard Salvo.text: Scrapyard Salvo deals damage to target player equal to the number of artifact cards in your graveyard.

printings.flavor:
"Squealstokers! Build me a glorious pile of Mirran metal. Then add yourselves to the pile."
—Furnace boss, sector 11

Sensor Splicer.name: Sensor Splicer
Sensor Splicer.text:
When Sensor Splicer enters the battlefield, put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
Golem creatures you control have vigilance.

Shattered Angel.name: Shattered Angel
Shattered Angel.text:
Flying
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may gain 3 life.

printings.flavor: She preaches the blessings of the Machine Orthodoxy.

Sheoldred, Whispering One.name: Sheoldred, Whispering One
Sheoldred, Whispering One.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.

Shriek Raptor.name: Shriek Raptor
Shriek Raptor.text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

printings.flavor:
"That's no glint hawk. The skies have changed for the worse."
—Ria Ivor, White Sun partisan

Shrine of Boundless Growth.name: Shrine of Boundless Growth
Shrine of Boundless Growth.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a green spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Boundless Growth.
{T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Boundless Growth: Add {1} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Shrine of Boundless Growth.

Shrine of Burning Rage.name: Shrine of Burning Rage
Shrine of Burning Rage.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a red spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Burning Rage.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Burning Rage: Shrine of Burning Rage deals damage equal to the number of charge counters on it to target creature or player.

Shrine of Limitless Power.name: Shrine of Limitless Power
Shrine of Limitless Power.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a black spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Limitless Power.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Limitless Power: Target player discards a card for each charge counter on Shrine of Limitless Power.

Shrine of Loyal Legions.name: Shrine of Loyal Legions
Shrine of Loyal Legions.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a white spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Loyal Legions: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield for each charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.

Shrine of Piercing Vision.name: Shrine of Piercing Vision
Shrine of Piercing Vision.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a blue spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Piercing Vision.
{T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Piercing Vision: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of charge counters on Shrine of Piercing Vision. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

Sickleslicer.name: Sickleslicer

Slag Fiend.name: Slag Fiend
Slag Fiend.text: Slag Fiend's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifact cards in all graveyards.

printings.flavor:
"Seal the furnace vents. Admit no others. We'll tend our forges without their tainted ways."
—Decree of Urabrask

Slash Panther.name: Slash Panther
Slash Panther.text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Haste

printings.flavor: It runs an endless circuit along the ruined roads of the soon-to-be-forgotten Mirran civilization.

Soul Conduit.name: Soul Conduit
Soul Conduit.text: {6}, {T}: Two target players exchange life totals.

printings.flavor:
"You have an unhealthy attachment to your selfhood. I can help you with that."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

Spellskite.name: Spellskite
Spellskite.text: {U/P}: Change a target of target spell or ability to Spellskite. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

printings.flavor:
"Let's show Vorinclex that progress doesn't always need teeth or claws."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

Spinebiter.name: Spinebiter
Spinebiter.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
You may have Spinebiter assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

Spined Thopter.name: Spined Thopter
Spined Thopter.text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Flying

printings.flavor:
"I appreciate the depravity of noble designs turned to devious ends."
—Tezzeret

Spire Monitor.name: Spire Monitor
Spire Monitor.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying

printings.flavor: Each monitor is given an eye for each spire it is to guard.

Surge Node.name: Surge Node
Surge Node.text:
Surge Node enters the battlefield with six charge counters on it.
{1}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Surge Node: Put a charge counter on target artifact.

printings.flavor: Without a foe to focus on, the machine priests had time to indulge in new sciences.

Surgical Extraction.name: Surgical Extraction
Surgical Extraction.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Choose target card in a graveyard other than a basic land card. Search its owner's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

Suture Priest.name: Suture Priest
Suture Priest.text:
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain 1 life.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may have that player lose 1 life.

Sword of War and Peace.name: Sword of War and Peace

Tezzeret's Gambit.name: Tezzeret's Gambit
Tezzeret's Gambit.text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Draw two cards, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

Thundering Tanadon.name: Thundering Tanadon
Thundering Tanadon.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Trample

printings.flavor:
"We do not need beakers and vials to test our predators."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

Tormentor Exarch.name: Tormentor Exarch
Tormentor Exarch.text:
When Tormentor Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"Tend the molten slag, or be the molten slag."
—Urabrask's enforcer

Torpor Orb.name: Torpor Orb
Torpor Orb.text: Creatures entering the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger.

printings.flavor:
"Phyrexia is certainly dangerous, but I have to admire some of its innovations."
—Tezzeret

Toxic Nim.name: Toxic Nim
Toxic Nim.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{B}: Regenerate Toxic Nim.

printings.flavor: The nim have become roving killers marshaled by whichever thane holds tenuous leadership.

Trespassing Souleater.name: Trespassing Souleater
Trespassing Souleater.text: {U/P}: Trespassing Souleater can't be blocked this turn. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

printings.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for surveilling our lives that we may be preserved from our own ignorance."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

Triumph of the Hordes.name: Triumph of the Hordes
Triumph of the Hordes.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample and infect. (Creatures with infect deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

Unwinding Clock.name: Unwinding Clock
Unwinding Clock.text: Untap all artifacts you control during each other player's untap step.

printings.flavor:
"The partisans have unearthed a strange artifact. None know its origin, but it gives them hope of a life beyond."
—Elspeth's journal

Urabrask the Hidden.name: Urabrask the Hidden
Urabrask the Hidden.text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

printings.flavor: When the Mirran resistance arrived, the furnace dwellers looked to Urabrask for guidance. His decree stunned the others: "Let them be."

Vapor Snag.name: Vapor Snag
Vapor Snag.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller loses 1 life.

printings.flavor:
"This creature is inadequate. Send it to the splicers for innovation."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

Vault Skirge.name: Vault Skirge
Vault Skirge.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

printings.flavor: From the remnants of the dead, Geth forged a swarm to safeguard his throne.

Victorious Destruction.name: Victorious Destruction
Victorious Destruction.text: Destroy target artifact or land. Its controller loses 1 life.

printings.flavor:
"The refugees look at these structures with hope. We must relieve them of this burden."
—Juex, tormentor exarch

Viral Drake.name: Viral Drake
Viral Drake.text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{3}{U}: Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

Viridian Betrayers.name: Viridian Betrayers
Viridian Betrayers.text: Viridian Betrayers has infect as long as an opponent is poisoned. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

printings.flavor: To secure a place in Phyrexia's ranks, they hunted their surviving kin.

Viridian Harvest.name: Viridian Harvest
Viridian Harvest.text:
Enchant artifact
When enchanted artifact is put into a graveyard, you gain 6 life.

printings.flavor:
"In the midst of horror beyond imagining, I still see things that lift my heart."
—Ezuri

Vital Splicer.name: Vital Splicer
Vital Splicer.text:
When Vital Splicer enters the battlefield, put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
{1}: Regenerate target Golem you control.

printings.flavor:
"For every one that falls, ten shall rise. The revelation of New Phyrexia is at hand."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

Volt Charge.name: Volt Charge
Volt Charge.text: Volt Charge deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger.name: Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger.text:
Trample
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, that land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

printings.flavor: "I will carve my people's vengeance on the face of Phyrexia."

War Report.name: War Report
War Report.text: You gain life equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield plus the number of artifacts on the battlefield.

printings.flavor: Underling Ethu's 263rd report read simply "Yes, my lord. Overwhelmingly, my lord." This marked the end of the Mirran-Phyrexian War.

Whipflare.name: Whipflare
Whipflare.text: Whipflare deals 2 damage to each nonartifact creature.

printings.flavor: The slag-workers wasted no time in creating their own flare pulses to cleanse the area of the incompleat.

Whispering Specter.name: Whispering Specter
Whispering Specter.text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever Whispering Specter deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, that player discards a card for each poison counter he or she has.

Wing Splicer.name: Wing Splicer
Wing Splicer.text:
When Wing Splicer enters the battlefield, put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
Golem creatures you control have flying.

Xenograft.name: Xenograft
Xenograft.text:
As Xenograft enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Each creature you control is the chosen type in addition to its other types.

printings.flavor:
"I despise Vorinclex and his slobberings about ‘evolution.' Only I know true progress."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
